introduction.section1: Maybe you have never heard of Siem Reap. However, you necessarily have heard about the Angkor Wat complex, which on its own makes a good reason to come to this country with its temples buried in the jungle, where nature reclaims its territory. Siem Reap is the start of this must-see site as well as the start to sail in Tonlé Sap Lake to observe the life of the floating villages. Besides, stroll the streets and discover the lively evening markets.
introduction.section2: Find out our travelogue followed by our detailed visits.

title: Siem Reap
meta-description: Discover Siem Reap and the ruins of Angkor Wat, and the life of floating villages on Tonle Sap Lake. For each place, we try to transcribe our visit as best as possible by telling you: Where to go? How to get there? Why? When? How long and at what period?
social-network-description: Siem Reap is famous for the Angkor Wat ruins which on its own makes a good reason to come to Cambodia You can also sail on Tonlé Sap Lake and observe the life of floating villages or take a walk in the markets at night. Discover these must-haves places with us.
